div1.head: Military Orders for Roger Post Ames, June 13, 1901
div1.p:
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Havana, June 13, 1901.

1. Captain Roger P. Ames, Assistant Surgeon, U. S.
Volunteers, is hereby relieved from duty at Columbia
Barracks, Cuba, and will proceed to Havana, and report to
the commanding officer, Pirotecnia Militar, for duty, reliev-
ing Contract Surgeon E. B. Barnet, U. S. Army, who upon
being thus relieved will proceed to Columbia Barracks, and
report to the commanding officer thereat for duty.

Captain Ames will in addition to his other duties also
perform those of the attending surgeon at the Department
Headquarters, during the temporary absence of Major
Dámaso T. Lainé, Surgeon, U. S. Volunteers.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

2. Captain William H. Block, Assistant Surgeon, U. S.
Volunteers, is hereby relieved from duty in the city of
Santiago, Cuba, and will proceed to this city, reporting
upon arrival to the Chief Surgeon of the Department, for duty
as officer in charge of the Medical Supply Depot, Medical
Disbursing Officer and Acting Quartermaster, relieving
temporarily Major M. C. Wyeth, Surgeon, U. S. Army, who
upon being thus relieved will avail himself of the leave of
absence granted him in par. 6, Special Orders No. 130,
current series, Headquarters of the Army.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:
